column2: Judge: Kushner Company Violations of MD Consumer Law "Widespread and Numerous"
column5: In an important development a Maryland judge has ruled that the Kushner Company has been violating state consumer protection laws in dealing with the tenants who rent apartments from the oft-cited company.  Saying the violations were “widespread and numerous” an administrative law judge ruled against the company owned by Jared Kushner Donald Trump’s son-in-law. The apartment company of Jared Kushner violated Maryland’s consumer protection laws numerous times at Baltimore-area properties by collecting debts without the required licenses charging tenants improper fees and misrepresenting the condition of rental units a judge has ruled. Today’s Baltimore SUN has the full story.  www.baltimoresun.com/...
